channel.title: [PI 317] Godwars killcount
channel.description: My godwars killcounts are not saving, each time i kill the npc for the kc it will count it and go up each time but after each kill from the npc it goes back to 1. So basically it goes up to 1 after the kill goes to 0 then after next kill goes to 2 and drops down to 0 again after that one dies.

item.title: [PI 317] Godwars killcount
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:30, topic:553543”]Unit testing lets you test individual modules of code (perceive the granularity of that how you will, imo it can be anything from individual functions to multiple non-io classes) by making assertions about what results they give you when passed certain arguments. The most popular framework in Java is JUnit.

If your code has failing tests it makes debugging a lot easier because you know exactly where the problem lies.[/quote]

How can i test this sort of thing?

Read full topic

Unit testing lets you test individual modules of code (perceive the granularity of that how you will, imo it can be anything from individual functions to multiple non-io classes) by making assertions about what results they give you when passed certain arguments. The most popular framework in Java is JUnit.

If your code has failing tests it makes debugging a lot easier because you know exactly where the problem lies.

I know how this site works we cannot give a straight answer but at least guide me with better information than just a few places I already know how to get to.

Here’s the thing i didn’t want the code… just didn’t know what you meant by the unit. Per say please explain what you mean.

item.title: [PI 317] Godwars killcount
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

How can I create a System.currentTimeMillis for my xp counter, i need the xp drop before the hit on people, and npcs i found this in my client.java but i think its only for the npcs attacking me.

if (System.currentTimeMillis() - singleCombatDelay > 3300) { underAttackBy = 0; }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI 317] Godwars killcount
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:553543”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=672454.msg4497190#msg4497190 date=1444699521]
I was thinking it was because i don’t have anything that i know of saving the kills when it happens, but i added new code in so that it worked in the public chat that tells the player how many kills they have but it still never displays in the interface shown
[/quote]
Erm… What?
What does saving have anything to do with this?
Since the player is logged in and actively playing, the “saved” value would not matter as they’re using the runtime values. Not the values that are stored in the character files (Hence why you can edit a character file as they are playing, and nothing changes for the player).

The problem is directly with the following 4 variables:

public int bandosGwdKC = 0; public int armaGwdKC = 0; public int zamGwdKC = 0; public int saraGwdKC = 0;

You need to find all instances of them. Meaning anywhere they are used, I want to see.[/quote]

Okay i found every where that deals with the codes above.
Actionhandler.java

case 26425: // bandos if (c.bandosGwdKC <= 20) { c.getPA().movePlayer(2864, 5354, 2); c.sendMessage("@blu@Solace wishes the best of luck to you"); } else { c.sendMessage("You need at least 20 kills to enter"); c.getPA().movePlayer(2863, 5354, 2); } break;
NpcHandler.java

[code]public void appendBandosKC(int i) {
Client c = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];
if (c != null) {
int[] bandosGodKC = {6271, 6272, 6273, 6274, 6275, 6268, 122, 6279, 6280, 6281, 6282, 6283, 6269, 6270, 6276, 6277, 6278};
for (int j : bandosGodKC) {
if (npcs[i].npcType == j) {
if (c.bandosGwdKC < 20) {
c.bandosGwdKC++;
//c.sendMessage("Bandos Killcount: " + c.bandosGwdKC);
}

				break;
			}
		}
	}

[/code]

client.java’s

[code]getPA(). sendFrame126("@cya@" + bandosGwdKC, 16217);

	getPA(). sendFrame126("@cya@" + armaGwdKC, 16216);
	
	getPA(). sendFrame126("@cya@" + saraGwdKC, 16218);
	
	getPA(). sendFrame126("@cya@" + zamGwdKC, 16219);
}[/code]

public int zamGwdKC; public int bandosGwdKC; public int armaGwdKC; public int saraGwdKC;

Read full topic

item.title: [PI 317] Godwars killcount
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

tank nation:

I was thinking it was because i don’t have anything that i know of saving the kills when it happens, but i added new code in so that it worked in the public chat that tells the player how many kills they have but it still never displays in the interface shown

Erm… What?
What does saving have anything to do with this?
Since the player is logged in and actively playing, the “saved” value would not matter as they’re using the runtime values. Not the values that are stored in the character files (Hence why you can edit a character file as they are playing, and nothing changes for the player).

The problem is directly with the following 4 variables:

public int bandosGwdKC = 0; public int armaGwdKC = 0; public int zamGwdKC = 0; public int saraGwdKC = 0;

You need to find all instances of them. Meaning anywhere they are used, I want to see.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI 317] Godwars killcount
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:12, topic:553543”]You have other code somewhere that is resetting the values. Either that, or you send the wrong values at some point in time.

For example:

case 26426: // armadyl if (c.KC >= 20) { c.getPA().movePlayer(2839, 5296, 2); c.sendMessage("@blu@Solace wishes the best of luck to you"); } else { c.sendMessage("You need at least 20 kills to enter"); c.getPA().movePlayer(2839, 5295, 2); } break;

You literally use the variable “KC” only in this part of the code.[/quote]

I was thinking it was because i don’t have anything that i know of saving the kills when it happens, but i added new code in so that it worked in the public chat that tells the player how many kills they have but it still never displays in the interface shown

Read full topic

item.title: [PI 317] Godwars killcount
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You have other code somewhere that is resetting the values. Either that, or you send the wrong values at some point in time.

For example:

case 26426: // armadyl if (c.KC >= 20) { c.getPA().movePlayer(2839, 5296, 2); c.sendMessage("@blu@Solace wishes the best of luck to you"); } else { c.sendMessage("You need at least 20 kills to enter"); c.getPA().movePlayer(2839, 5295, 2); } break;

You literally use the variable “KC” only in this part of the code.

[code]if (System.currentTimeMillis() - specDelay > Config.INCREASE_SPECIAL_AMOUNT) {
specDelay = System.currentTimeMillis();
if (specAmount < 10) {
specAmount += 1;
if (specAmount > 10)
specAmount = 10;
getItems().addSpecialBar(playerEquipment[playerWeapon]);
}
}

	getPA(). sendFrame126("@cya@" + bandosGwdKC, 16217);
	
	getPA(). sendFrame126("@cya@" + armaGwdKC, 16216);
	
	getPA(). sendFrame126("@cya@" + saraGwdKC, 16218);
	
	getPA(). sendFrame126("@cya@" + zamGwdKC, 16219);

	if (followId > 0) {
		getPA().followPlayer();
	} else if (followId2 > 0) {
		getPA().followNpc();
	}
	getCombat().handlePrayerDrain();
	if (System.currentTimeMillis() - singleCombatDelay > 3300) {
		underAttackBy = 0;
	}
	if (System.currentTimeMillis() - singleCombatDelay2 > 3300) {
		underAttackBy2 = 0;
	}[/code]

item.title: [PI 317] Godwars killcount
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

sk8rdude461:

None of that is related to displaying the interface, nor updating it.

public static void godWars(TextDrawingArea[] tda) { RSInterface rsinterface = addTabInterface(16210); addText(16211, "NPC killcount", tda, 0, 0xff9040, true, true); addText(16212, "Armadyl kills", tda, 0, 0xff9040, true, true); addText(16213, "Bandos kills", tda, 0, 0xff9040, true, true); addText(16214, "Saradomin kills", tda, 0, 0xff9040, true, true); addText(16215, "Zamorak kills", tda, 0, 0xff9040, true, true); addText(16216, "0", tda, 0, 0x66FFFF, true, true);// armadyl addText(16217, "0", tda, 0, 0x66FFFF, true, true);// bandos addText(16218, "0", tda, 0, 0x66FFFF, true, true);// saradomin addText(16219, "0", tda, 0, 0x66FFFF, true, true);// zamorak rsinterface.scrollMax = 0; rsinterface.children = new int[9]; rsinterface.childX = new int[9]; rsinterface.childY = new int[9]; rsinterface.children[0] = 16211; rsinterface.childX[0] = -52 + 375 + 30; rsinterface.childY[0] = 7; rsinterface.children[1] = 16212; rsinterface.childX[1] = -52 + 375 + 30; rsinterface.childY[1] = 30; rsinterface.children[2] = 16213; rsinterface.childX[2] = -52 + 375 + 30; rsinterface.childY[2] = 44; rsinterface.children[3] = 16214; rsinterface.childX[3] = -52 + 375 + 30; rsinterface.childY[3] = 58; rsinterface.children[4] = 16215; rsinterface.childX[4] = -52 + 375 + 30; rsinterface.childY[4] = 73; rsinterface.children[5] = 16216; rsinterface.childX[5] = -52 + 460 + 60; rsinterface.childY[5] = 31; rsinterface.children[6] = 16217; rsinterface.childX[6] = -52 + 460 + 60; rsinterface.childY[6] = 45; rsinterface.children[7] = 16218; rsinterface.childX[7] = -52 + 460 + 60; rsinterface.childY[7] = 59; rsinterface.children[8] = 16219; rsinterface.childX[8] = -52 + 460 + 60; rsinterface.childY[8] = 74; }

Read full topic
